meanings.definition: A deficit in a bank account caused by drawing more money than is actually available.
meanings.sent1: She realized she had an overdraft when she tried to withdraw money and the ATM declined her request.
meanings.sent2: I need to check my bank statement to see if I have an overdraft.
meanings.sent3: The overdraft in his account was a surprise, like finding a hidden treasure.
meanings.sent4: Her bank account was a deep well of spending, with the overdraft as the bottomless pit.
meanings.sent5: The overdraft in his account was like a black hole, sucking up all his money.

meanings.definition: The act of withdrawing more money from a bank account than is available.
meanings.sent1: His frequent overdrafts led to hefty bank fees.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to incur an overdraft by spending more than you have in your account.
meanings.sent3: The overdraft on her account was like a game of financial limbo - how low can you go?
meanings.sent4: The overdraft was a warning sign that he needed to manage his finances better.
meanings.sent5: She learned the hard way about overdrafts when her card was declined at the store.
